alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:16AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Tammany Parish, northwestern Harrison, Hancock and southern Pearl River Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 216 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sun to 6 miles north of Diamondhead. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Kiln, Mcneil, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington and Lyman. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana near mile marker 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 4 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
